column2: ['Something I really like about my high school is the diversity of people. The more people the more language and culture you learn from them.', "The school's curriculum is amazing, but the only problem I have is the secretaries at the office. There is this on particular lady who just seems to in a bad mood all the time.", 'This school is good all the teachers all the responsible person in here but the problem it’s that’s too dirty but about the rest have a excellent service', 'Admiral William F Halsey is a great school where you can be able to learn . Teachers are amazing at teaching kids especially when some students don’t know the work . Halsey tries to do their best on making kids feel safe and special . Halsey makes us want to reach for our dreams also Halsey gives us opportunities to see different colleges to see which ones we’ll like . Also they help us figure out what we want to do after high school .', "I love how you they have different strands like nursing and ROTC etc. Not only do they provide you with different strands they also provide you with avid classes that help you with your college process. Although, they focus on helping students through their college process isn't great which is why their is a less precentage of graduation.", 'My experience at admiral.W.F. halsey Leadership Academy has been really good. One of the things I like about Halsey is how well organized things are', 'The school is very sub-par with very few real educators employed as faculty.  The recent change in School Administration has however greatly improved the atmosphere and image of the school.  Although this is a step in the right direction more must be done especially in terms of funding for the school.', 'At school you want to feel safe, you want to be able to learn peacefully. But I don’t feel that way at Halsey at all. No one cares about you. Half the teachers are just there for their paychecks. You can be so terribly depressed in that school, & no one would care. The school is crazy, but if you want to go to school just for “fun” & to take nothing seriously. I seriously recommend Admiral William F. Halsey Health & Public Saftey Academy to you.', 'I originally began Halsey Academy wanting to become a marine because of their MJROTC program. The First sergeant at the time was an incredible guy! But after a year into the program, it seemed like it wasnt what i wanted to do with my life so i went off to join the nursing program and began volunteering at my local hospital! Little did i know that my science and math teachers at the time would motivate me to go into a STEM related field since i enjoyed those classes so much. Halsey Academy has been so great to me! I am honor to be the Senior class president and represent the diversity and how good the school has become.', "The teachers work as hard as they can given the students that attend that school. The students are very aggressive and have attitude like you wouldn't believe.", 'Adm. W.F. Halsey Leadership Academy has helped me learn about several life situations and how to handle them in rough times. The school has been a multicultural atmosphere that has helped me shape myself into who I am today.   However, what I would like to change would be the motivation of many of the students, make them want to come to the school and have a peaceful and educational school system.', "I was apart of the MCJROTC program which i did enjoy, the school was a great start for my academic career. It's the just the student environment wasn't really the best. The teachers were great and the academics were interesting.", 'My overall experience in Halsey Academy was the best. I liked lot of things about it. The teachers are very good and are were always there for me when I need help.', 'I came to this school last year and my experience here have been rough for so many reasons. Some things have to be change.', 'What I like is that their are students that communicate with each other and have a good connection. I would like to see activity in my school.', "My experience at halsey is different because our school is very different from others in good and bad ways. First of all halsey can be a safe school but many times we can be considered the worst. The way we learn is great we learn mostly something new every single day and the teachers will sit with us to help us out with anything we have trouble with. Halsey is a very diverse school that I don't regret going to whatsoever. ", "This school has many issues but there are many teacher who are willing to help you and help you in your future but many other that are not . Sometimes I don't feel safe in the school because of the incident that happens. I would like for the school to change the teachers to other teachers that advocated to their children's education and there will be more safety.", "I mean it's okay but could be better, the nurse don't take care of you all they do is give you ice for something. And the security guards does there job. They always checking your bag, and make sure your in uniform. Also make sure no one from different schools come in. The health programs comes to my class every Thursday to talk about our health and have events for us and bring in health smoothies. The school is safe but sometimes I feel unsafe when someone makes a bomb threat or something, but other than that I feel safe.", 'When it comes to extracurricular activities it fun. Everyone love the extracurricular, from the sports to the different clubs, and to the different outside activities.', "At Halsey, I learned to become a better person, and that not everything needs a reaction to  it. My favorite experience at this school is that whenever I was going through something I could always go talk to Mr. V and Mr. M. They always things in a perspective where you could understand both sides, and they'll always keep it real with. They tell you the truth because they know no one else will.  The unique thing about the school is the teachers, because when you go to Halsey people always think were a bad school but in reality were not, we just be going through somethings that we can fix by just talking to someone, like your favorite teacher. This is the reason I'll go back to Halsey if i could, I just wish i had these teachers earlier."]

column6: ["There are many teachers who actually care and want to see you make it in life. But on the other hand there are teachers who come for the pay check, and no care what happens to you. The teachers who does care will constantly be on your case about your grades, attitude, colleges essay's and all. They make sure your good, they talk to you with respect, and teach you things that will him you in real life. Like how to do tax's, your credit scores and etc. But that's only a handful of teachers, the rest just don't pay use no mind.", 'Everyone is open to new people. They are willing to talk to new students and show them around the school or introduce them to the community', 'The school has a good safety policy but health is not really great. The food that is given is not that healthy', 'There were few club activities and I did not hear a lot about some club activities in the school. I joined the Poem and Debate club, which started off great until after the semester. I was not able to find out where their meeting was held anymore. The activities in the school is fun but there are less information about them.', 'When it comes to education, the school is great at helping every student achieve the best. Apart from that, there are not many events or activities entertains the students. Students have to find out for themselves whether there is a club or activities they would like to participate in.', 'The teachers at the school are good at associating with people and making sure that everyone is doing their best. They are willing to help a student as long as they are willing to put in the work.', "I'll say it's alright for a high school having many students in this building, i feel like during drills they can be more strict about them", "There could be more clubs associated with the Halsey House since they separated Dwyer and Halsey. i think Dwyer gets more of the opportunities then we do, and I've only been here for my senior year.", 'Well I transferred over from my former school Thomas A. Edison, I miss it but it was for a good reason.', "We don't really get to choose", 'The security barely check bags, due the amount of students in the school. S', 'We barely have extracurricular activities due to the environment we are in.', 'I am personally not involved in any sports but I have friends who have been involved in sports since their freshman year and it has helped them grow as a person and taught a lot of them about responsibility and commitment.', 'I would choose this school again because despite all the bad moments that occurred throughout my 4 years there, there have been plenty of good ones as well which I would never take back for anything in the world.', 'Not all but some teachers do really care about the students and are working hard to get each of us the same amount of education needed to graduate and become successful in the future', 'Some students are able to smuggle things in the school but the security team tries their best to keeps the school as safe as possible.', 'Many of the extracurriculars could have better quality. Due to the district budget not many things can be financially done about them.', "many of the teachers in my school are very approachable and friendly. Many students give them a hard time but they don't allow this behavior to affect them much. They try to academically help students as much as they can and they try to be consistent with grading.", "Since my freshman year it has gotten better, way better, but it's just that some teachers are negative.", 'All in all students have to be more mature in learn that Education is so important. Th whole school has to think of making the school better.']

column2: ['This school is terrible because these kids hate Abraham Clark and the teacher don’t teach very well.', 'Abraham Clark Highschool had its up and downs, but mainly downs. In my four years of going there, 2 of my math teachers were fired. Instead of taking the time and hiring good teachers, the school decided to go on first come, first served.', 'What I liked most about this school is the fact that you are given a lot of opportunities to ready yourself with the real world and network with people who have become very successful in their lives. These opportunities can include clubs, sports, or programs that this school provides. It is also not hard to become involved with different programs.', 'This school overall has improved in the last 5 years thanks to the new principal. He has worked hard to build the school from the ground up and has shown itself to be quite a character. Full of young and bright students who are willing to fight for their education.', 'The teachers cared a lot and always went out of their way to help students. Principal mickens was awesome and put his heart into taking care of students.', "Abraham Clark High School is not the greatest school. Rules are constantly changing, the administration is always going back on their word and the students are getting worse by the year.But, I can't deny the teachers, staff, and students who try their best in my school. They put in the effort when others don't and that means a lot to me.", 'School has so much potential but not enough opportunities. Students lack motivation. If we really tried this school could be good.', "School is wack, no diversity what so ever and is run by teachers stuck in there old ways. A few good ones but that's it. Students are ignorant and annoying.", "My experience at Abraham Clark High School was pretty decent, since my first day I stepped into the building I felt very at home and it felt like a family. The small town of Roselle was full of local town supporters that made my school experience a lot better due to me transferring to the small town my Junior year of High School. Overall I enjoyed my two years at Roselle and I believe the town's public school system is very hands on with they're students and community.", 'Some of the teachers shouldn’t even be teachers, it’s hard to understand what they are teaching. The facility needs to be updated,some classes don’t air conditioning. We need a new Bsketball coach and program!', 'Staff and Teachers are pretty good, but there are some flaws in how the school ran back when I was there. Mainly in how some of the classes where structured.', "The entire school district of Roselle needs help. Abraham Clark High School is lacking in so many areas alone. However inadequate the environment may be, the students have ambition; especially if they are involved in sports, the JROTC program and/or other school programs.  We all aspire towards bigger and better things. Most of the teachers and staff members encourage us and provide their wisdom. Although our voices are heard, there isn't much the teachers can do. The problem, as aforementioned, is in the administration and lack of involvement from parents. Additionally, the school is worn and unsanitary. I could go on, but I won't.", 'I really was able to see myself grow in this school. I’ll sleeve RAM ready! But, the school does need a few improvements based on upgrading and updating certain things.', "I have been in this school for three years and from what I've experienced, most of the classes and activities I have been involved in have been a little over my expectations. If you take honors/AP you're in good shape, the students in those classes are well mannered and well behaved. The school lunch is terrible, there isn't enough choice other if you don't like what they are serving then you are getting salad or a sandwich everyday. The after school activities take about thirty minutes to start, there is not enough involvement in them. This school mostly focuses on athletics, even if you're just a visitor, you'll be astonished by the quantity of trophies when you walk in.", 'I started at Abraham Clark High School in 2014. I was nervous and anxious at the same time, since i was coming in as a freshman.  The teachers are very helpful and they push you to do your best.  They are always willing to help you before and after school. The administration is awesome as well.', 'Graduated class of 2016 , Met amazing teachers there, had a lot of fun memorable experiences, learn lots of new things about myself over the years.', "This school has made my high school years a very decent experience. The best thing about it is that their main goal is for you to graduate, however we're not being prepared for college.", "This school did not prepare me for college in any shape or form. The work I would sometimes do in some of my classes was child play! For instance, my English teacher decided that it would be a good idea to put us students into little groups a draw a family tree of The characters from one William Shakespeare's play/books. THAT WAS MY SENIOR YEAR!!", 'My overall experience with Abraham Clark High School was " ok" its the best place to get your education but at least we are getting a education and thats all that matters.', 'My experience at Abraham Clark High School was nothing shy of pleasant. Our principal was lovely and wanted all of his students to succeed.']

Instead of taking the time and hiring good teachers, the school decided to go on first come, first served.', 'What I liked most about this school is the fact that you are given a lot of opportunities to ready yourself with the real world and network with people who have become very successful in their lives. These opportunities can include clubs, sports, or programs that this school provides. It is also not hard to become involved with different programs.', 'This school overall has improved in the last 5 years thanks to the new principal. He has worked hard to build the school from the ground up and has shown itself to be quite a character. Full of young and bright students who are willing to fight for their education.', 'The teachers cared a lot and always went out of their way to help students. Principal mickens was awesome and put his heart into taking care of students.', "Abraham Clark High School is not the greatest school. Rules are constantly changing, the administration is always going back on their word and the students are getting worse by the year.But, I can't deny the teachers, staff, and students who try their best in my school. They put in the effort when others don't and that means a lot to me.", 'School has so much potential but not enough opportunities. Students lack motivation. If we really tried this school could be good.', "School is wack, no diversity what so ever and is run by teachers stuck in there old ways. A few good ones but that's it. Students are ignorant and annoying.", "My experience at Abraham Clark High School was pretty decent, since my first day I stepped into the building I felt very at home and it felt like a family. The small town of Roselle was full of local town supporters that made my school experience a lot better due to me transferring to the small town my Junior year of High School. Overall I enjoyed my two years at Roselle and I believe the town's public school system is very hands on with they're students and community.", 'Some of the teachers shouldn’t even be teachers, it’s hard to understand what they are teaching. The facility needs to be updated,some classes don’t air conditioning. We need a new Bsketball coach and program!', 'Staff and Teachers are pretty good, but there are some flaws in how the school ran back when I was there. Mainly in how some of the classes where structured.', "The entire school district of Roselle needs help. Abraham Clark High School is lacking in so many areas alone. However inadequate the environment may be, the students have ambition; especially if they are involved in sports, the JROTC program and/or other school programs.  We all aspire towards bigger and better things. Most of the teachers and staff members encourage us and provide their wisdom. Although our voices are heard, there isn't much the teachers can do. The problem, as aforementioned, is in the administration and lack of involvement from parents. Additionally, the school is worn and unsanitary. I could go on, but I won't.", 'I really was able to see myself grow in this school. I’ll sleeve RAM ready! But, the school does need a few improvements based on upgrading and updating certain things.', "I have been in this school for three years and from what I've experienced, most of the classes and activities I have been involved in have been a little over my expectations. If you take honors/AP you're in good shape, the students in those classes are well mannered and well behaved. The school lunch is terrible, there isn't enough choice other if you don't like what they are serving then you are getting salad or a sandwich everyday. The after school activities take about thirty minutes to start, there is not enough involvement in them. This school mostly focuses on athletics, even if you're just a visitor, you'll be astonished by the quantity of trophies when you walk in.", 'I started at Abraham Clark High School in 2014. I was nervous and anxious at the same time, since i was coming in as a freshman.  The teachers are very helpful and they push you to do your best.  They are always willing to help you before and after school. The administration is awesome as well.', 'Graduated class of 2016 , Met amazing teachers there, had a lot of fun memorable experiences, learn lots of new things about myself over the years.', "This school has made my high school years a very decent experience. The best thing about it is that their main goal is for you to graduate, however we're not being prepared for college.", "This school did not prepare me for college in any shape or form. The work I would sometimes do in some of my classes was child play! For instance, my English teacher decided that it would be a good idea to put us students into little groups a draw a family tree of The characters from one William Shakespeare's play/books. THAT WAS MY SENIOR YEAR!!", 'My overall experience with Abraham Clark High School was " ok" its the best place to get your education but at least we are getting a education and thats all that matters.', 'My experience at Abraham Clark High School was nothing shy of pleasant. Our principal was lovely and wanted all of his students to succeed.']

column2: ['The teachers care. Teachers at Hempstead High School work hard to make sure students do well. They teach with a passion. There is a variety of extracurricular activities and opportunities available.', "My experience with hhs was decent. Every school has their flaws, but hhs has unnecessary flaws. I can't speak for other students, but the teachers I've had (some of them) got distracted easily by the kids who would start trouble and if I wasn't the determined person I am, I believe that I would have a very difficult time focusing like other students. That's why most students don't care and give up.", 'For Hempstead High School you really need to focus on graduation and checking up on your grades to make sure they are actually in the system. There are many experiences in that school that I can not make up. Most of them was loosing class grades after taking the class 3 times. I wish for the best if anyone is trying to graduate.', "I have been going o this school since 2016-2020 and i have met great people here our school has a bad reputation because some of the students don't care about school or isn't able to keep going and some fights happening but recently there hasn't been any fights and I don't think it is fair for the school to get backlash I want the school who has helped me become better be better. I hope being able to get a scholarship can also help the school and the future students.", 'Hempstead high school is struggling to improve, even to the point where the state has to step in. The administration pays attention to unimportant things and refuses to take the advice of the teachers that provide valid points for improvement.', "Hempstead High School is known for violence but only if you're a student inside the school you would know the opposite. Even though we are targeted by the news everyday deep down it has taught you many things other schools won't. I only hope it would improve and the violence would stop.", 'I enjoy the genuine interest of some the teachers. Many will stay after school or come on the weekends to help you study and further your college readiness. The guidance counselors are always willing to help and they offer many resources. I would like classes to be more organized because many students are trouble makers.', "Well it's sports really get me wanting to bring my grades up because they may playing fun.I wanted to do all the sports there. There teachers at least the ones I've had were great at teaching me i was a bit hard headed about doing the work but i got through it with the help of most of my teachers they new i had potential that and could do my work if i just tried and did my home work i would be able go and do something great. But for me just knowing was fine i didn't have friends there so relying on movies and tv when i got home was more exceptional for me. Bit if i had been more attentive in my studies maybe i wouldn't have to try getting so many scholarships i would be offered them instead but here i am didn't listen to the teachers so here i am.", 'Hempstead High School is a very interesting school I could say. There could be more things to help out the students. More interactive school activities for different types of majors.', 'What I liked about Hempstead High School is that teachers and staff care about you, I also liked that the school is very involved in extracurricular activities. The school offers many clubs and sports. College advisors help you out a lot and last when it comes to extra help or studying for regents exams some teachers go out of their way to help you in every way possible.', 'In my experience attending Hempstead high school, I would try to change the publicity the school receives. In my four years attending, there were several major changes in regards towards college readiness, advanced courses, and opportunity that went unaccounted for. As a student who saw the opportunity in advance courses made it my goal to attended at least one college course every semester. With the help from faculty members, I received college courses from accredited schools that opened my horizon to more opportunity. The media focuses too much on the negativity that occurs but does not acknowledge the positive change and growth that happens at Hempstead High School.', 'What I love about Hempstead High school is that is a big school, clean and all the teachers were kind and would help anyone who ask.', 'What I loved about my school was that from teachers to staff members and guidence councilors they all try there  best for students  to get good grades and pass there classes and regents. They also try there best to make us feel like young adults and to make right decisions in life decisions that will make us harvest our future. What I’d like to see change is the way they schedule our classes and to be more responsible with students overall requirements also what I’d like to see change is that students shouldn’t have to wear uniforms to school because I feel its giving us less liberty and also the fact that they detain us if we don’t wear it. Students shouldn’t have to worry about if they’ll be allowed in school according what they wear unless it is inappropriate the the school dress code. Other than that the school is amazing', 'The overall attitude of the students would be essential in turning around the school. Students are focused on anything but an education which is why the school does poor.', 'First off, respect due to Mr. Roy, Mr. Levi, Ms. Hazel and Mr. Jackson. I attend Hempstead high, and it’s not THAT bad. The news portrays the terrible things that go on in the school, while there is much good to combat the bad. The food isn’t bad but it could be much better, the students are not so nice, facilities are old and worn down..college readiness isn’t enforced. Hopefully I can graduate and get out and just move on. Maybe the school may get better overtime. I’ll try to go back and help out, but other than that, Hempstead is okay, it’s really not the best but I’m proud of my school (somewhat). Shoutout to the senior class of ‘18', 'My experience at Hempstead high school has shaped me into the person I am today. However, being that I go to Hempstead high school, I have many limits on education. Hempstead is known to be a failing school. It is believed that the students who go into or leave the school are also products of failure. However, I am not the product of what the society expects me to be. Attending a school that is known to be an insufficient school for years, I have to work 10 times harder to be in the same bracket as other students who attend a school that is known to be successful. Hempstead can be a great school if all teachers and students applied themselves. Even the board of education can be more involved with the school and actually ask and give the students what we need such as a new field. I run track, and the track on the field is horrible making it hard to practice. My friends and some faculty made me really enjoy my experience at Hempstead high school.', 'This school is better than what the news and other sources make it out to be. The environment is very easy to learn in and fun at the same time.', "My experience at Hempstead High School has been good. I would like to see a change in the staff, I feel as many do not care about how they teach and they tend to treat all the students the same. I also feel like administration should do a better job with making every child feel safe, because I feel as if I always have to be careful no matter if I'm not doing anything wrong. The school overall has been okay, just like any other school. I sometimes which that all sports where also treated the same such as football and the volleyball team. Ive experienced it first hand where I felt like giving up. Listening to girls in class talk about there cool uniforms and headbands, when the  sport I was doing did not have any uniforms and any equipment that we needed to perform good in our sport.  Yes , I did feel embarrassed to compete at other schools and we did get laughed at but I had to make the best out of what i had. ", "All the teachers I've had except for 1 are very approachable and likeable. Even the ones who I don't have or briefly encountered are respectable and knowledgeable about most questions. Except the 1 mentioned earlier I've thoroughly enjoyed every teacher I've had since starting there in 9th grade.", "They're many security guards they do just enough"]

column8: ["The school its self tries its best to provided various extra curriculum actvities for students but students don't take advantage of these opportunities and administration sometimes gives up calling it quits with the organizations they provide", "This school is something special because of student's backgrounds and overcoming them striving towards success. I would choose to attend this school again because of what I experienced attending it today to do better and be better", "On my part the majority of teachers I had are caring and engaging individuals I can't speak for all.", 'They are pretty good at that point, because of their devotion of our security.', 'they are many clubs for different languages and also other knowledge club.', 'I would choose this school again if  could do it all over because, the members care a lot about their student.\r They also give you support on everything.', "They always try their best to help us, specially those who have difficulties.\r Despite certain conditions I'm proud of them.", "Throughout the years i've attended this high school, i have struggled academically because of a few bad influences around me. But as the years progressed, i stuck with a positive crowd, thus improving as a student. Now a senior at the high school, i realized how bad our school is represented through the media, when in reality every other school is nearly the same, Hempstead High School is just the main target for a reason i do not know. I love my school, its just a few negative students around, but our school provides a lot for us. I couldn't have asked for better helpful teachers who have motivated me to become an excellent student. Although our school has a terrible reputation, i am one of many students who is willing to change the perspectives of many about our school.", 'Very unorganized, grades get lost, and or misprinted. No one cares about you, you have to care about yourself to graduate.', 'My favorite experiences would be just the memories i have with my friends here. This school has a lot of hidden talent but not enough people to help nurture it. If i could do high school all over again, i would probably be the only person from my school to choose this school again. My school has a very low graduation rate that improving, low testing scores, inefficient administration department but it drive us students who wants to show the outsiders who we really are. It motivates us to do our best and strive for excellence.', 'The school has great teachers who are looking for the best interest of the studeny. Even though the students are not really disciplinary, if you know what crowd of people you associate with the most, you will have a great experience there.', 'wouldnt do it again. would like to go to a different high school.', 'use to have an option of school served lunch or nachos or sandwich but now its sandwiches or the regular school lunch', 'dress code was very strict. Atendance wasnt really a big issue. bullying was a big problem, thats why alot of fights accurred.', 'weight room had a few machines, track was horrible, holes everywhere. Football field/ lacroose field was always nasty, birds used the bathroom on it all the time and it was real grass so it had alot of dirt and mud patches. rarely any grass', 'some of the teachers will go above and beyond for the student, but there werent many like that', 'program were not funded efficiently so if the student or coaches would have to come out of pocket with most expenses. Most teachers didnt want to spend more time in school then they had to so most clubs couldnt get started because no one wanted to run them.', 'my high school did nothing to prepare me for the real world. My school was just full of violence, rude teachers and a different principle each year was was jsut to fed up with the school system that they didnt care what was going on. \r they didnt solve problems they just suspend people.', "At our school, we have a Student Government which is directed by a teacher everyone loves. We have Club Truth, which is a Christian Youth Club, it's a great opportunity to be around people with the same beliefs as you & have serious open discussions. We have Girl Chat which is exactly what it sounds like. We chat with each other about things going on in our lives advice for certain situations etc. Everybody is caring & loving in these clubs and it makes you feel warm, welcomed, and wanted.", "There is a lot of technology. But most of the promethean boards in all classrooms don't work or teachers are unaware of using them. So they aren't always used, it's rare. But there is a computer lab and media center filled with computers that are accessible to students."]

I transferred here in 2016 which was my 9th-grade year & from then I didn't have any complaints about this school.", 'A change I’ll like to see is more whole school activities such as prep rallies also rules being enforced clearly.', 'the school is overall good it prepares you foe college by giving us courses and advice on it but i wish it would provide more sports', 'Equality Charter High School is a school that prepare you for college and make sure you are ready for the work force. It  ensures that it provides the traits of maturity and  professionalism.', 'it helped me be successful within my classes and get ready for college and what is ahead of me to learn in college', 'They provide you with opportunities that you either want or forced to have. Then when you feel that it’s too much for you they try to convince you that it’s all good and you should take all possible opportunities. Nothing is wrong with that but I feel that, the stress is never worth it. When I first started I was ready to stress but it wasn’t good for my health. Mental and physical health should take a higher importance than education.', 'This school is not awful but some of it’s practices is keeping it from acuatlly being a great school. The administrators are really supportive of their staff and tries to help teachers grow into a better educator but that soft heart has enabled unqualified teachers to overstay their welcome. In particular there is a Math teacher( Solages) that was hired, this man wasn’t good at teaching but he got a lot of support, but the school took too long to replace him. Due to this, many calculus, algebra and pre-calc students did not learn what they needed to for college. I hope the school continues to help their inexperienced teachers grow but stay firm to know when to let certain people go.', 'In equality the teachers go above and beyond in most highschools they don’t push there students to go for advance but in equality they see our capability and push is to go for our advance rather than a regular dipolma', "Equality Charter High School was overall a pretty decent school. With such a small school and classroom setting, it allows the teachers to really focus in on each student's needs. Academically, I am satisfied with the school. This school also offers students some really great opportunities, some of which I have participated in such as connections to Internships, dual enrollment in college classes, and more. Despite there not being a large body of students and staff, communication and organization still seem to be a big issue in this school. Overall though I had a pretty good high school experience.", 'At Equality Charter High School, everyone is accounted for and no child is left behind. Also the core values that were instilled in me from the teachings are still with me to this day.', 'I like the way each teacher teaches but I would like to change the favoritism they have for some students, especially the ones with the worst behavior. Even though they do have a lot of college preparedness programs along with internships, they still are well underdeveloped.', 'The main thing I love the most about my school are the teachers and staff members. I love the fact that they are always concerned for and with their students. They always made sure if someone looked moody or upset, they would always check up on them. I feel as though the culture of the school could have been a little more better and the incentives for the students could have been higher. As well as flexibility the students had.', 'In my experience,  equality charter high school has a high rate of teacher turnover, and inconsistency in school procedures,  policies, and grading. Lack of materials like textbooks and student workbooks leads to several worksheets on a daily basis per student.', "The Equality Charter School is an amazing and strict school. The students are expected to arrive on time and be dressed appropriately by the school's given uniform. The teachers that attend the school care deeply about the students. They are willing to lend a hand for those that have trouble in their academic performances. They push the children to try their hardest and to be the best that they can be. They provide a safe environment for the students to take their academic tests and to not feel subconscious about themselves when participating during a classroom lesson. They provide free access to laptops, books, and programs. The school also allows parents to be involved with upcoming school events by creating  Award Ceremonies, Holiday dinners, Pep Rallies, and Sports games.  They don't play when it comes to the students safety. They do not tolerate bullying of any kind, psychical and food fights, skipping or being late to class, and stealing.", 'My four years at Equality has been spectacular! They value education so much and the staff really prepare me for my future.', 'Great facility with high expectations and education value they work to ensure all students are on track to graduate while creating a safe and fun environment']

['The teachers and staff are helpful and make sure the students are on track, but there isnt much diversity or extracurricular access', "Before graduating from middle school, I've applied to a total of 12 high schools and SHR was the only school to accept me and give me a second chance to prove myself.  Middle school did not go so well for me due to my lack of English but I've come a long way at SHR. The teachers there have helped me a lot throughout the way. They've given me as much help as they could. And now here I am, one of the top student at school.", 'As a current senior in the School for Human Rights, I admire how much the school staff encourages college readiness on students. However, I would love to see more school spirit and activities in the near future.', "It's a great school for academics, but for school culture, there isn't really one. The students have no sense of community or the drive to be involved in the community. They only stay in their small groups. The schools name is also very ironic because the school has no focus on human rights advocacy or education. And there is almost no student voice in the policy making. If you just want to go to school, learn,then go home,this is the school for you. If you want a strong community and to feel like someone cares,and that your voice and strength matters then don't go there.", 'The teachers and principal would treat the kids as their own and equally. They would always encourage you to do your best and always be there for you whenever needed.', 'The school for human rights is an incredible school, even though I’ve only been there for one semester now. This is my first year in this school and the teachers treat me as if I was one of their own children. They’re very nice and it’s hard to understand why people say bad things about the school.', 'I am opportune to attend this school. I feel connected to the people and traditions. The school is culturally enriched, however i would love to see more of student activities.', 'My experience with The school For Human Rights was stellar. This school made it their goal to make sure each student was going to college and also ready for college. They made sure we were on track with the process of applying to college which was extremely beneficial because we had staff members to help us. As far as school activities we did a lot. From fundraisers, Field day, and etc. These events helped students build a closer bond not only with each other but our community.', 'The school is a great institution, that drives students to success. Students are provided trips, clubs to gain experience and enhance their knowledge about life.', "I attended middle school and high school. The teachers actually cared about the students learning and retaining the information. Most students had a person in their family who was an alumni. This was one of the many reasons the principal was always after literally every student's wellbeing. Although the school didn't receive so much funding, but the Assistant Principal strived to incorporate several programs which focused on the social and academical development of incoming high school  freshmen. I also partook in this program which allowed me to go on many trips and seminars like in Chicago and Georgetown and howard helped me grow mentally taught me how to be publicly aware going into a higher institution. The parent teacher association planed events and activities for students to help motivate them congratulating those who were proficient in performance and encouraging those who didn't perform so well.", 'My experience with The School for Human Rights was good for the most part I got a lot of opportunities from the school and there was always a sense of a community. However, I would love to see more extracurricular activities added for students to engage in.', 'love the teachers its litt over here really intresting', 'Awesome love it here its great to come and chill love', 'The teachers at The School For Human Rights are well trained and experienced in their subjects area to help the students understand the material really well and  most teachers try to incorporate the different types of learning styles into consideration like visually and auditory. The teachers are tealy organized and their aim for you as a student is to prepare us to be college like last semester my English teacher gave us a syllabus and it was helpful to me by the aspect of helping me to remember and organized and on time with my assignments. Our teachers do a good job at making jokes in their lessons to help students to I understand while having a good time.', 'Well its great this year since the campus/school is now teamed up with NYU Lutheran versus when they were previously teamed with SUNY Downstate.', 'Whatever clubs that are started are usually disbanded before you graduate because no one keeps up with them. School Government as well as council is selected through some pretty B.S way. This year a junior was our president while the valedictorian as well as the salutatorian were given minor positions if any at all. All sports with the exception of the tennis club and the basketball team are Varsity as well as campus wide. Their are also a lot of teams most walk on. The only teams you have to basically audition for are the Varsity Tennis Team as well as the Varsity Basketball Team.', "The overall quality of the teachers at The School For Human Rights is okay. I say this because many of the teacher's do not put in their all. With the exception of the ELA teacher Mrs. Smith as well as the occasional science teacher Mr. Andrew, with the Social Studies teachers being an exceptional as well the rest of the teaching staff is extremely lazy. And for the most part they seem like they cant wait to transfer right up out of their. The communication skills of the teacher to student are sub-par at best as well as the consistency in grading. The math high school math teachers are bias with the exception of the lovely Ms. Henry and once they find a favorite student forget the other people in the class.", 'Third best school out of the 4 that currently reside in George Wood Wingate Campus. What it lacks in Human Rights subjects or anything law related ,it makes up for by aggressively trying to get you to sign up for AP classes . Many a club started and ended due to lack of motivation. I fear that the class of 2016 will be the last good graduating class.', 'The Campus Clinic is very straight forward and outspoken.', 'No one has brought in weaponry into the school.']

column2: ['Malcom x shabazz high school is a great and awesome school everyone wants to attend Marvelous ,full of laughter,educating  and existing', 'MXS, like many other schools, is what you make of it. You won’t find any other school where the teachers are as extremely dedicated to uplifting their students. Granted, there are administrators who aren’t up to par and even students who give you bad days, but being a bulldog (our mascot) is being family. We look out for one another and without a doubt want to see our classmates succeed. Love surrounds our atmosphere and friendships even though our circumstance may be lacking. We’re inner city kids with big futures ahead of us, and our school is so impactful we will proudly claim our alumni status. Thank you.', 'After moving 3 times my high school years, I finally landed at Shabazz in which I was forced to follow through with and graduate. I’ve been in other schools where you know the education is no joke, the tests are all worth studying for, and the athletics are something you need to compete in because if you get in, prepare to be trained like a professional. However, Shabazz is the complete polar opposite. Teachers who don’t want to teach and students who run the classroom. A fight in each hallway, and security guards smoking up right outside our “safe zone” of a school. Overall, this whole place is a joke and I genuinely feel horrible for the teachers who’ve been there long enough to know there will never be improvement because they themselves have tried, and failed.', 'Malcolm x shabazz has one of the best history I have heard. This school has outstanding  teacher and lots  of fun activities. The students of Malcolm x shabazz are very intelligent, fun, friendly and determined. The most interesting thing about a student of Malcolm x shabazz is that everyone of us has GOALS.I have lots of great experience at Malcolm x like our fashion show, games, movie night, Malcolm x day even the library has what a student needs.Malcolm x Shabazz is a safe school and a place you meet different kind of people from different countries with different cultures. Being in Malcolm x shabazz has done lots of positive things for me like having me trust myself and my teammates and being recognized NSHSS organization, giving me the opportunity of becoming a member and as a bulldog I am proud of myself and I am happy to be part of the Malcolm x family.', "Malcolm X consisted of teachers who were willing to get you college and career ready. It's diverse  in regards of people from around the globe attending the school.", "Three years at the school was smooth sailing. My classes were fairly easy and making friends wasn't an issue. There's many opportunites the school offers. All I had to do was look for them", 'My junior year in Shabazz , Everything was really disorganized and all over the place. As of now the new principle is doing a very good job. The school is more organized , the staff is more professional and the academics are improving.', "When I got to MXS I was scared out of my mind. I had recently transferred in from a small Liberal Arts HS in Brooklyn and wasn't prepared for the campus-like feel of MXS. It's a very big school, mostly for the athletically talented but there's a space for everyone. School spirit it intense. I ended up joining the cheer squad, geochemistry team, and two honors societies. There are so many resources, there isn't any reason why a person shouldn't make it out Shabazz. The coaches, teachers and other staff actually care about their students and the principal is so involved, he knows every student by name and gpa.", 'This school is what you call a “potential” prison. It’s just disgusting honestly. The money and whatever else only goes to the football team. There are a select few teachers that care about you and your future but the rest really don’t.', 'School is not bad, make sure you hang with the right people and focus. Not many people in the AP courses, but if it’s best for you get in those classes.', "Academically, I was given many opportunities to prove my intelligence around others, and how much of a leader I am. With these given opportunities, I've been a top ten student in my class for most of my years in this school. Also, I was thankfully inducted into the National Honors Society, a society that consists a group of students with a GPA of a 3.0 and up, and show leadership skills.", 'My high school experience here was about average. Some of the teachers and staff would make an effort to connect with the students while others were just there to earn their paycheck. The building itself made me feel like I was trapped inside of prison and the cafeteria needs a major fund because the food they fed us there was atrocious. During the summer the heat inside of the school would make me and many of my peers uncomfortable to learn. The school sports department mainly revolves around football and basketball. They had to cut the soccer and golf teams as well.', 'Malcolm X shabazz high school is a good school that gives students the opportunity to achieve their goals ranging from studying to one-on-one help from teachers when required. Malcolm X shabazz enrolls excellent students who graduates in time.', 'the extracurricular programs we have are some sports, band, garden club, and some teachers may offer tutoring', "One of my favorite experiencing at this school was freshmen year when there were a lot of electives and pep rally maybe every month. That what made me say this isn't bad after all because the principal wasn't strictly academics , he believed in a little fun . Now its strictly school work which why the students attendance is super low. I wouldn't choose this school again because i don't fit in with the people here. They are rowdy while I'm claim .", 'I have been honor classes since my freshmen year so I can not really give my opinion on all of them. From the teachers I have met seems to really care about the students understanding the later , they even offer there time during lunch or after school.', 'Their is a non bullying policy', 'They had sister hood groups, brotherhood groups, technology groups,  art clubs and etc.', 'At this school it was kind of comfortable because everyone treats you nice , you get a lot of assistance with things and they have a lot of activities for you to get into.', "I believe the teachers in my school are great because they take time to help the students out when they are in need of it and they do a very well job of it and that's what type of teachers students need in the school."]

Harding is not located in one of the best parts of Bridgeport however, I decided to attend this school because of a Medical Magnet program it facilitates, which is one of two in the state. Despite its faults in some areas I have been surrounded by friends, teachers, and administrators who genuinely care about me and want to see my succeed.', 'There is always room for improvements.', "I wouldn't re-do those years.", 'They try to help each student as much as they can.', "Not the greatest atmosphere in which to teach so school doesn't attract the greatest teachers.", 'School does make available many after school activities for those students willing to take advantage of them', "School like this doesn't attract top shelf teachers.", 'Kids at this type of a school act out but there is always staff around to intervene.', "Generally thankful that a school like this exists.  The student body is obviously challenged emotionally and so that inevitably makes it a less than perfect environment. The teachers often complain about pay and the principal,the ceo, etc.', 'The teachers were helpful but limited by administration', 'The new administration is better now compared to 2011-2014 school years.', 'they offer basketball... it could be better.', 'the school nurse is never available.', 'my overall experience in the school was unique in the sense that it felt like a family due to how little the school population was.', '73% of the teachers at this school actually put in the work and are always willing to help students which is important and the main the reason why students go to school.', "When I started to go to the school It was bad but now it is good because there are now more stuff to be done and now kids can started working to apply to college. Also this school can be hard sometime when kids are noting listening to the teacher. The kid will have there time to talk to the teacher one on one if the kid need help with something or did not understand what the teacher was teaching that day. The teacher want's to help the kids to pass the class, so she/he will help you with everything they got. .", 'can be better need more stabilty teachers', "My school is bad when it comes to extracurricular activities. We only have Student Government, Cheerleading (basketball season) and basketball. This is the reason why my school doesn't have school pride because of the simple fact that we don't really have activites. The participants of SGO have so many ideas for the student body but their proposals are shot down by the Vice Principal or the student body doesn't want to participate due to their school pride being so low. Not a lot of people try out for sports because they have different interests that the school does not offer.", "When it comes to health, I personally think that the nurse isn't at the school when we need her. She has assigned days to come to the school and take care of us. When she's not here, we're instructed to go home if our parent decides to pick us up. The school is okay as far as safety within the school. The school is very strict on bullying and we have a HIB form that has to be filled out once bullying is taken place. In the HIB (Harassment Intimidation and Bullying) process, a teacher who is in charge of this would review the form and talk to the student or whomever is involved in the incident. The consequences of having someone write an HIB on the accused is that they'll recieve a suspension from school (the amount of days may vary depending on how bad the incident was). All in All, the school that I attend is strict when it comes to safety within it's boundaries or property.", "This school is the worst I've been to and I'm not referring to the students. The students and my relatoinship wit them re mainly my reason for staying. But i can honestly say, I am going to transfer.", 'Lack of student involvement, but student acceptance is great', 'Very heavy work load not enough study options. No popular classes but gym.', 'This school is very strict on the uniform policy but not strict on anything else. We do not have a actual principal in our building. I attend the 11th and 12th grade building on 88-108 Shipman st. in newark, nj. Something needs to be done.', 'Teaching style is not like other schools. Some are too slow some are average paced. Communication skills are terrible and this school has unnecessary courses.', "There are no security, and one person behind a desk who is never paying full attention to who's coming in or out of building. Building windows are very close to ground, students are capable of jumping out and safely landing. Building isn't safe at all.", 'Guidance counselors are unknown, faculty are worried about uniforms more than grades.', 'We do not have any clubs, just one student government. No cheer leading team at all for the basketball players and no girls basketball team.']

column2: ['McKinney Is a performing arts school that helped me get out my shell through vocal and performances. The teachers and staff that worked there truly cared about the students and went above and beyond. The only thing I wished was different was having to worry about uniform.', "This school is terrible the teachers do not care about their students and don't care if you pass or fail and it's drug and gang infested people do whatever they want in this school.", 'JHS 265 is a decent school. Besides the location of the school, everything is up to par. It’s an okay school, I wouldn’t recommend it, but I wouldn’t advise for someone not to go there.', 'Attending this school has allowed me to expand my horizon , not only in education, but life itself . I feel very connected with my teachers as well as other staff . Lastly , the school had provided students such as myself , with many resources, involving us in a wide range of opportunities, to better our future .', "My experience at this school wasn't the best. In fact it was far from the best. The problem with this school is its lack of communication between the faculty and its students.  Events go unsaid and undiscussed until the very last minute of the event. There is a lack of preparation within the school when it comes to anything. That includes regents, parties, even performances. This school faces the major issue of bad communication resulting in the altering in the future of the student that attend.", 'McKinney is not a bad shcool .I think the shcool has ghetto kids and they are not under a strict order so they are wild .I think if there were more strict rules it will be an excellent shcool', 'The experience here is okay. There are some teachers that actually care but there are some teachers that don’t. You have to care about yourself in this school.', "In McKinney, you will find a very comfortable and caring environment. The school has a very tight-knit student/staff relationship, almost as if the school itself were a small community. However, the school's comfortability does leave some things to be desired when it comes to discipline and structure. Organization could be a little bit more prevalent as well as communication between students and staff.", 'I enjoyed going here. I felt that the teacher were very knowledgeable and they cared about the students.', "McKinney is one of the best Performing Arts High Schools ever because for once it's not just about competition. It's a school where students are taught to work together and bring each other up instead of competing with them. The teachers are extremely supportive and cool. They always have the students best interest in mind when coming up with new teaching styles or even creating new projects. People often get turned off by the fact that it's a small school but honestly that's what makes us all like family.", 'i love how they was always willing to help with collegesplan and help you guild. i love how they have did groups and teami love that we are all close like a family.i would change most of the teacherthe foodthe way they go about things the why they share information', "Dr. Susan S McKinney is a great school it's just the kids make it seem bad. The learning process at the school is great teachers make sure their students are doing what they need to do to pass. Not only is learning fun but also the fun activities within the school such as dance, music, art, theatre, basketball, cheerleading and much more.", "Student life at McKinney is a family, even if it's cliche to say so. Students a well connected to one another and the teachers, who all encourage students to achieve greatness. Friendships are valued at this school. These friendships help students create a bond that stays strong, even when friends leave. The teachers really get to know their students on a personal level. It seems to be more than just an academic institution with them, but more like mentorship. They strive to make sure that each student is aware of the resoursces and opportunities that await them in their future. ", 'McKinney is a great school. It has so many activities the students can take part in. And also the teaching methods are incredible.', 'The teachers in McKinney are AWESOME!!! They are also helpful.', 'Due to budget cuts, extracurricular and after-school activities have been cut.', 'School Security is always present and safety issues addressed immediately.', 'A majority of the teachers truly care about their students and their success. These teachers make themselves available to those students who struggling, reinforce those or doing well to continue, and provide additional resources when necessary. Communication between the staff and parents is available via school visits, telephone, or through teacherease.com email. \r The school is currently divided into three sections: High School, Junior High School, and just recently the elementary charter school. Space is an issue for many of the dance, physical fitness (PhyEd) classes.', 'They do the best they can do to everyone safe at all times. If its in school or near school premisses.', "Well I'm not in no after school programs. But i know students who are and they actually like it."]

Anthey adjust the learning styles to fit the students style of learning.', 'My duration at Mckinney is not over but it will be next year. Out of everything there is a lot of life lessons you take away from this school. At the end of the day it depends on the type of student', "I am actually still attending this school and I love it. The students are so talented. We are like a family. Teachers and students truly become your second family. Teachers truly go out of there way to help you. I actually have Saturday regents prep tomorrow with my Chemistry and U.S. History teachers. They aren't getting paid for that, they just want to make sure we have are ready. You will never find a school so close and filled with talent much like us.", 'I feel safe most times.', 'They become apart of your journey. They are there for you. The teacher always try to push you to do more and excel.  They break the lessons down . The teachers link lesson to each other smoothly. The U.S. History teacher uses music to teach certain time periods. And has also made days  devoted to  certain time period. We had a day where we turned the class into a speakeasy. The entire 11th grade became people from the 1920s and performed skits, song,poems,dances,even news reports based on the roaring 1920s. The chemistry teacher does fun experiments. The 11th grade class made rock candy. She even use lyric references to explain topics or processes in chemistry. We were learning about acids and bases and there reactions to indicators. I asked "What if you mixed an acid with a base and place a base indicator?" she followed by filling a flask with an acid and placed an indicator. We all said in unison, "Drop the base!" she laughed and dropped the base which she later linked to our next topic. The Spanish teacher is so funny. Her lesson emerge you into understanding a how other culture wither it be Spain, Mexico or even  Puerto Rico. We dress and celebrate Hispanic culture quite often. We also link the cultures to our own. It helps better the respect  you may already have for other cultures. The 11thEnglish teacher makes lessons a games. we once used songs to describe characters from  "The Color purple"\'s emotions towards one another or towards a situation. Even her projects are fun. We once got a list of projects we could do for the stories we read through out class. I only remember a few; Write a story that extends the ending to a story we read this marking period, bring a food the characters might have had during the time period the story was based on, create a short film on any story we\'ve read, and even create a scene (painting, sculpture,etc.). They catered to all talents. There is so much more but  I clearly don\'t have the room to even do this justice.', 'Basket ball\r girls be heard\r Musical theater class\r The elites (dance team)\r Marching band\r Cheer leading', "They often look like they're serving leftovers. Like I said, you get what you put in!", "Fitness is available to anyone that is interested. column2: ['it was average because the school is not really diverse and there are not lots of kids at the school. there is not a lot of sport at the school and i would rather go to a school that had something to do with my major in college', 'This school has more cons then pros. While there were some ineffective teachers, there were also some amazing ones- unfortunately though, some of those amazing ones left :(.  I definitely hope for this school to improve big time.", 'teachers Preparatory High School has been as school that has always have determination to help students pursue their education and passion to the fullest and this has been one of the things that has rub on to me too.', 'When I first attended this school in the 6th grade, it was a grade A school with wonderful teacher, wonderful staff and the best principal you can have. There were many after school clubs to keep the students interested in school and many fund raisers to help the school with new appliances. Steve Harvey even gave the school $2,500 from an essay one of the guidance councelor wrote. It was the best school you could send your child to. Years has passed and it had dropped way down. The principal left and after that, the school has never been the same.', 'I like the different types of clubs they had to offer.As well as for the positive vibe of the student relationships.', "Teachers Preparatory a high School is a wonderful school they strive to see their students excellent and do very well . They make time to have Saturday and even classes to help prepare each and every student for regents and other exams I wouldn't change a thing about Teachers Preparatory because without them I wouldn't be the person I am today.... Each and every teacher has a great personality and are very willing to help .", "Teachers  Preparatory high school had a good environment, however the staff wasn't so welcoming at times and the academics wasn't the best", "I've experience so many wonderful learning experiences at Teachers Prep. The teacher's are wonderful and really help to want to work hard to be successful in life.", 'I liked that they have a variety of sports for boys and for girls to, also that they encourage you to graduate early and push you to become a teacher but also support you in your own goal in life.  ', 'In one of the programs called TFT they give you a hands on experience to works with kids in a different school as a teacher aid while observing the obstacles you might face in the teaching field', 'My overall experience was good in a sense that teachers looked out for students and tried their hardest to keep them on track. Also to keep me busy after school sports were available and were worth it', 'Certain teachers work to make sure the students are on track to Graduate on time. They also work extended after school hours to make sure the students understand the work to the fullest', 'The health and safety policies at this school helps students stay safe. There are codes that the staff follows in order to make sure that nothing happens to the students. There are alarms and cameras all over the building to ensure the safety of everyone.', 'I believe the best program at this school is the arts center program because students can express themselves through acting, dancing and drawing. There are not many extracurricular opportunities besides sports like volleyball, double dutch and basketball.', 'At this school, I have met people who become my best friends and teachers who were kind and loving towards me. I knew if I ever needed help that they would be there for me. At this school, I enjoyed the little parties we used to have for celebrating holidays and the trips I went on with my classmates.']

column6: ['The teachers are this school encourage students to do the best that they can do. The teachers push students to be successful and guide them down the right path.', 'The teachers make this school a decent school; without them it would be a mess. The dedication and the extra " push " from the teachers to the students are the best.', "The teachers at TPS are dedicated to their students. Many teachers even stay after school and on weekends for regents prepnor to clarify any information a child doesn't understand. They do not complain nor make it feel as though you are bothering them. The teachers at TPS have teaching skills that work for their students.", 'I feel safe for the most part.', 'Dedication is rarely found at my school.', 'Being with my friends makes it worth being here.', 'All of my teachers teach in different ways.', "Overall, high school has been okay.  I had some great  teachers in terms of Global, Trig, freshman&junior year English, and dance classes, but a few of the others teachers aren't effective in terms of teaching.  My biggest problems have been the disorganization with scheduling, schools events (which we hardly have), and extracurricular activities.  In fact, we don't have a range variety of choices with programs and activities.  I always wish I went to a bigger school for resources, diversity, and more trips.  However, the upside is that some classes are small and feel more personal.", 'This school is okay .', 'I have to admit that in this school I have made many memories that I wouldnt give up for the world. But they are also memories I wish I could forget. Throughout the years, I have witnessed my classmates failing classes and regents not because the course was hard, but because the teacher refuses to teach the class in a way the students understand. Because of this situation, my gpa is not as high as it could be. Even after complaining to the principal, she would do nothing of the situation.', 'The health policies at my school are very good. Safety is also at its best as we have school police that are very good at what they do and help to keep us safe.', 'I think the fact that schools even provide free lunch to some students is amazing. Coming from a country that you had to pay for lunches every day, I appreciate the lunch system implemented in schools. I think students should be more appreciative and understanding of all the effort thier schools put in to provide them with healthy lunches every day.', 'Teachers are keen on correction students when they are wrong. My school is very big on preparing children for the real world and they teach them that to be apart of it there are rules and regulations that are mandatory for you to follow.', 'School spirit is an integral part of my school community. We share a very high sense of togetherness and support to our athletic teams.', 'The teachers at my school do their very best to make sure their students receive the best quality education. The push us to do our very best and students benefit from it every day.', "My school provides an environment where students feel as if they are at a second home. Teachers are helpful and understanding and to some of my peers very good friends. We feel a sense of family at Teacher's Preparatory School and I hope to bring the values they have instilled in me throughout the rest of my adult life.", "The administration at the school is very strict. The school-wide policies are heavily emphasized. The principal is very helpful whenever you need her she's always there. The guidance counselor is great she's very knowledgeable and always helps the students. However, she's very strict when it comes to deadlines. Bullying is not tolerated in the school. The dress code is heavily emphasized as well but the students don't complain because it's a very common dress code and we can dress down on Fridays and on certain days. Attendance is must at the school.", "The sports at the school is very intense. They are played at a very high intensity because we are very prideful of our school. Our schools boys basketball team went undefeated 4 seasons in a row. The fans at our school are the best they make the game very exciting. The school spirit is phenomenal. I've never seen a bunch of students take so much Pride in their school team. The athletic facilities are put that good but we made use of them.", 'The teachers at the school are great. They are high quality teachers and they have very unique teaching styles. They teach as if we were learning from a "real world" perspective. They use examples from everyday life in their lessons. They are very knowledgeable of the subject they\'re teaching. They communicate with the students very well and they are always available after school. They communicate with the students very well, they always put things in a way where the students can understand. The grading in consistent and they are very fair when grading.', "The extracurricular activities are very intense. The level of commitment for the sports and clubs are very high. They are high because people like to see the teams compete and the sports/clubs are very fun and the coaches make it better. The most popular club/sport is the boys basketball team. It's the most popular because it's a lot more competitive than the rest. The administration was very supportive, they came to every game."]
