column1: Eagle Academy for Young Men III
column2: ['I attended Eagle academy since 7th grade and the happy moment I have there never dry. I make good relationships with my teachers, the friends that I made are creative and funny individuals, and most importantly, the school listens to the students and they try there best to help the student learn and enjoy life as they grow older into young Men', "In Eagle Academy For Young men 3 was a well rounded school with a great care for the young men that were in attendance there. the school has had great college advisers that care for the students' success like they were their own sons. the sports there are great and the facilities are becoming greater. the academics are set to be challenging for the young men so that they can be college ready when the time comes. my experience at the school was great and i would recommend for young men to attend this school because of the good wholesome culture that will set the young men up for future success in the long run.", "There's a lot of bad about this school. In my time there as a student there were 4 different principles, the eating area was never clean, it would more times than not be overcrowded and not a very good environment for the students.", 'The new principal and administration are very dedication in supporting us both academically and socially.  They always go the extra mile to help us develop into well rounded men.', "Eagle Academy is a school that does care personally about their students. Being there from when that specific eagle academy was founded, has allowed me to see the growth that has come from that school. when it started off we had borrowed space in which we had to share in a cramped section of a school building that wasn't ours. Eventually, we were able to purchase our own building. Though there has been a lot of growth there has been things that have always been there that will not be changed such as erratic behavior from students and sometimes under competent teachers are things that negatively affect the academics in the school. The main programs and clubs throughout my high school career were football basketball and a few academic programs, I feel like the diversity nor the quantity of the clubs just wasn't ever there, and I feel like if it were, I would've found something I was interested in to participate in and be a part of. Other than that the school is manageable and bearable.", 'Eagle Academy is trying to make African Americans included and better in the world, but act as if it’s some sort of exclusive cult for black students only, and important administration address us as brother & are extremely biased, we only have TWO sports, basketball and football & the students on the teams get a pass by teachers so they can continue being on the team, it needs more activities & they need to learn how to uplift African Americans without tearing down/excluding another race', 'I am now a senior at Eagle Academy For Young Men 3 and, I am pleased to be part of this institution. Over the course of years, Eagle Academy have helped me improve in my character, academically, and my intellect.', "Eagle Academy Queens is still relatively new so I didn't expect it to be top notch. Although for me this school doesn't give me anything since it's main focus outside of academics is sports, they do have some of the best teachers there. They do care for you, but the environment is somewhat off and sometimes it's unorganized. I've been in this school for 4 years and in those 4 years I've had 4 principles.", 'The thing that i like about Eagle Academy is the structure and the dedication that the school has for their students to be successful in life. Eagle Academy teaches you structure, discipline, confidence, leadership, effort, academic excellence, resilience and many more. Eagle aAcademy always has support from the parents and the community around it.', "Eagle Academy got me on the right path to graduate. I've had a supporting group of teachers who made sure I was always on track.", "I have found that being a member of the Eagle Academy for Young Men, as allowed me to enrich my educating by primarily staying focused on the academic aspect of learning without the constant distractions of the much larger public schools.As an Eagle, I've built bonds with my fellow eagles that has allowed me to learn the true meaning of fellowship and gain a true sense of friendship.", 'When I first came to Eagle I expected to be taught how to grow into a responsible young man. However, that belief was quickly tarnished once I reached seventh grade. The teachers frequently change throughout the school year, majority of students have no discipline, and there are very few extracirricular activities to join.']

['Bassick high school it’s great school, I love how it is very diverse among teachers. The kids are not only book smart but street smart, if only the school got more funding they will be more advanced.', "Administration is poor even though teachers are nice and friendly always helpful. As a student many have favoritism and worry more about sports than any other thing. If an administrator sees a student they like they don't say anything but if it's any other student you get in trouble. I've gotten items stolen and security couldn't do anything about it.", 'Bassick is a school where education dies. The school has great diversity and a great basketball team. Yet that’s all this school has to offer. Other than sports their isn’t much to do.  Teachers are great; however they lack in keeping their students engaged. As well as college readiness is abysmal so is parent participation. This school is setting up young adults with great minds for failure.', 'When I arrived in unique states I thought everything would be like in the movies. I expected it to be like the high school musical however I learned a lot from me by being in a different environment. I would like to change the perspective of the students according to their diet and the relationship that the cafeteria has.', 'I liked the fact that unlike other schools Carsick high school does not have a high bullying rate. In my 3 years of attending I have yet to see any type of bullying.', 'Despite a lack of funding and a mismanaged administration, my experience at bassick has been a pleasant one. Most of my teachers have been thoughtful and helpful and most of the students here are great. The one thing I like to see change are the administrators', "It was a very bad experience going there and I regret getting flunked out of Notre Dame and going to Bassick. It was a punishment in itself, along with the summer school. I've gotten my phone stolen. The teachers, save for a select few that I really cherish, all felt like they didn't care much about anything. One class played nothing but movies every day and I didn't learn a single thing. The school had metal detectors but I'm sure it wasn't efficient. There was fights frequently, and the food was rancid. One point it smelled like rotten cheese for a month straight in the cafeteria. Every single day it smelled like that I couldn't even stomach to eat there. Only saving grace was I lived closed to school so I could walk home after school quickly away from it.", "Bassick for me was the best, I had amazing teachers who I have great memories with. Freshman year was tough I was still adapting to high school but everything change when I started sophomore year. I had the same teachers for 3 years which was amazing because I knew I could count on them when I had a problem. The teacher that I though was the strictest became a very nice lady once I got to meet her. I don't think my experience at Bassick would have been the same if I wouldn't have had those 3 amazing teachers every year for 3 years.", 'Bassick High School has been great to me from the teachers to the students . Sports here were amazing the coaches were great as well . My classmates were also good because they helped me when i was struggling and i helped them but overall over all four years i had fun at this school And it was a excellent experience i wouldn’t have changed it for nothing in the world . It also made me a better person as a whole', 'Basic is a very old school that is in desperate need of renovation. The buildings have no AC units that keep the school at a cool temperature and the over all school needs to get fixed. Due to budgets, the school had cut many electives that students particularly enjoyed.', 'Although Bassick has a bad reputation, it was a great school. The teachers are very respectful and well educated above the necessary education needed to teach at Bassick. The environment is welcoming and supports student individuality and allows students to make academic decisions on their own, with guidance and assistance from the faculty. The students are average inner city students, which is why Bassick has a bad reputation, but if you focus on your education and ignore all the distractions around you, you will do well at Bassick.', "When people think of  Bassick High School the first words that come to their mind is dirty and ghetto. Before I started attending this school I used to think it a dirty and ghetto just like everybody else. I was so afraid to attend this school based of from the stories I heard. Once I started attending the school my whole mindset changed I met so many great people in this school. The diversity is amazing. There's also so many teachers I have come across that loves doing their jobs an helping students learn. The administrators actually care about the students.  Bassick is such a good school but there are still so many improvements that need to be done to that school but there are still so many improvements that need to be done to that school. First of it needs to get a rebuild. The school has been up for hundreds of years the materials they use in the school is old and worn out. There are cracks in the ceilings in most classes and when it rains it leaks through.", "The only good thing about Bassick are some of the teachers and the students you attend the school with. ['There wasn’t another school I wanted to go and I was excited to come here, but this school is definitely not perfect. My biggest complaints are with administration and teachers. The administration here is laughable. They don’t do much and everyone knows it. I wish they cared more and were better at there jobs but it doesn’t seem like they’ll be changing anytime soon. Also, some of the teachers here are laughable as well. Some are creepy, have had multiple strikes on their file for various concerning reasons, don’t know how to teach, or just generally don’t like kids. Despite that, there are a couple of teachers who are really passionate about their job and make learning fun! All in all, I’m still glad I went here but there were things I would change.', "School doesn't offer sports or much for extracurriculars. College-readiness /resources depends on whether the staff believe that the student can get into a top college.", "Its average. Nothing really makes it stand out against the rest. It does offer more engineering and science courses. The diversity is very poor and when you try to change it, teachers try to prevent it. College readiness is very poor, if you don't ask for the help they don't help you.", 'I really liked the option to choose your courses as a student, it really allows us to think about what we want to pursue and lets us take charge of our future. I also liked the easy communication between teachers and students.', "I like the teacher to students ratio and the fact that the hands-on help overall the school gave to each student really helped out a lot when it came to your studies of interest, guides for extra help when needed and the interactions the teachers had with us students made you want to learn and further your future. There's nothing I would really like to see change besides their own sports department.", 'Overall, the academics are rigorous and the facilities are well-kept and provide a positive educational environment.', 'Small, comfortable, clean, and easy to navigate. Lacking in sports, after-school clubs, and school spirit - all of which can be found outside of AITE if one so desires. Much preferred over other options (surrounding district high schools). Certainly not for everyone, but excellent for those seeking a school focused on education rather than the "high school experience".', 'I love the Academy of Information Technology and Engineering. Its as if the school was built just for me. I love the academic challenges the school gave me and the people it had to offer me. It definitely changed me for the better and is one of the reasons of who I am today. There were challenging moments through my High School career however i knew it would only make me a stronger and better person through the end.', 'I love the PLTW engineering courses, and the use of technology in every class. All the teachers are willing to help their students succeed, and the community in general is very welcoming.', 'What I love about my school is the opportunity that it offers to students like me, a Hispanic female. It offers various programs that have helped students find enough resources to their career. One thing that I would like to see change in my school are more programs to make sure that the students are happy. I agree that it is a school with discipline, but there needs to be a way for the students to enjoy their years at this school.', 'Like all schools, AITE is very adamant about getting their students ready for college. We always used to have meetings and discussions concerning applications, scholarships, and teacher recommendations so that me and my peers knew as much as we could about the college process. The teachers are very responsive and engaging with their classes, along with providing a positive environment for all involved. There is also great diversity within the student body and the faculty and staff.', 'This school is amazing. It provides you with so many opportunities for the future. The academics are rigorous but extremely worth it as there alumni attending schools such as Yale and MIT.', 'Its a very diverse school and because of it being such a small school I think it helps a lot of the students get more assistance.', "When I first entered AITE in September of 2014, I had no idea what I wanted to do, so I shopped around. AITE offers an extensive engineering program through Project Lead The Way - so I enrolled in their introduction to engineering club. I liked the course and the instructor and also working with the 3D modeling software but it wasn't the right fit for me. I tried a multiple of business classes, which really sparked my interests into becoming an entrepreneur. I also really enjoyed the Cisco Networking classes they provided and I think it gave me a solid idea of what I want to do in the future. Overall, great academic school, high standards. Small clubs, smaller environment though. Many students prefer it that way.", 'No sports is very annoying. Teachers are fine, and overall the academics here are awesome. But, for literally anything aside from academics, the school is not very good.', 'It’s wonderful to see teens from all over the county & from all walks of life, get along so well. The science, engineering, & math are tops, but the music, arts, & languages are amazing, too. I wish all high schools were like this.', 'I love AITE with a passion. Before applying and getting accepted, I attended two very large public schools. I can say with confidence that AITE is an amazing, family-like community that strives itself to improve every individual to make themselves their best selves; it truly cannot compare to my past experiences with other surrounding school districts. Instead of making sure the school looks good on paper (focusing attention and money on top students), our school focuses on every student individually and makes sure students with special needs, learning disabilities, and even challenges get the same level of education as every one else. Of course our school is known for its strong engineering and biomedical sciences program, but I’m in neither and can proudly say that; other programs at our schools our just as good.', 'AITE is very diverse and inclusive; there is little to no bullying. I find the teachers and guidance to be severely inept and lazy. The language department and math department as a whole is a complete joke. I suggest taking as many electives as you can and ask around to find the best core classes you can take that focuses on your major in college.', 'The Academy of Information Technology is a pretty good high school of choice for those in the Stamford area and surrounding cities. The school building is relatively new and the campus is open for students (Only Seniors can leave campus). The schools has some good teachers and some not so good ones. The student body is very small and most people get along well. The courses offered in the Biomedical fields and the information Tech fields are great.  Overall its a good school for preparing students for the difficulties of university.', 'AITE is magnet high school in Stamford, CT. The schools is in a state of the art facility just almost 10 years old. The school has unlimited technology resources and programs for the students to explore and accomplish any task they seek. Most of the staff is supporting of what the students do and will spend the time to problem solve with them. The community is very close and everyone works together. The school truly prepares you for college and career readiness. Our 88 minute classes allow for students to accomplish a lot and do more than other schools may be able. We may be a smaller school but we are strong and big. My experience at AITE has been amazing. The environment and the teachers make it seem like you are not even at school.']

The science, engineering, & math are tops, but the music, arts, & languages are amazing, too. I wish all high schools were like this.', 'I love AITE with a passion. Before applying and getting accepted, I attended two very large public schools. I can say with confidence that AITE is an amazing, family-like community that strives itself to improve every individual to make themselves their best selves; it truly cannot compare to my past experiences with other surrounding school districts. Instead of making sure the school looks good on paper (focusing attention and money on top students), our school focuses on every student individually and makes sure students with special needs, learning disabilities, and even challenges get the same level of education as every one else. Of course our school is known for its strong engineering and biomedical sciences program, but I’m in neither and can proudly say that; other programs at our schools our just as good.', 'AITE is very diverse and inclusive; there is little to no bullying. I find the teachers and guidance to be severely inept and lazy. The language department and math department as a whole is a complete joke. I suggest taking as many electives as you can and ask around to find the best core classes you can take that focuses on your major in college.', 'The Academy of Information Technology is a pretty good high school of choice for those in the Stamford area and surrounding cities. The school building is relatively new and the campus is open for students (Only Seniors can leave campus). The schools has some good teachers and some not so good ones. The student body is very small and most people get along well. The courses offered in the Biomedical fields and the information Tech fields are great.  Overall its a good school for preparing students for the difficulties of university.', 'AITE is magnet high school in Stamford, CT. The schools is in a state of the art facility just almost 10 years old. The school has unlimited technology resources and programs for the students to explore and accomplish any task they seek. Most of the staff is supporting of what the students do and will spend the time to problem solve with them. The community is very close and everyone works together. The school truly prepares you for college and career readiness. Our 88 minute classes allow for students to accomplish a lot and do more than other schools may be able. We may be a smaller school but we are strong and big. My experience at AITE has been amazing. The environment and the teachers make it seem like you are not even at school.']
column6: ['A.I.TE. is a very special place where students who usually felt misplaced in middle or elementary schools can find a home. Everybody is super accepting there so most of the students quirks or hobbies are all appreciated and there is always a person who will understand. The teachers are great except for some of the math teachers and some language teachers however all it will force you to do is work even harder to meet your standards grade wise. Other than that though the rest of the teachers are absolutely fantastic and genuinely care about there students and where they end up in life and college.', 'I enjoy the ability to explore areas in which I would like to pursue a career in the future.  With the Biomedical and Engineering classes, it allows students to be even more prepared and advanced compared to other students when going into college.  Even though it is a small school, I think that there should be enough classes so that each student can take all the classes they desire and not be penalized because the class is full.', "This is a magnet school that accepts by lottery and sibling connection only. This school has great courcecs that the other public schools don't have. It is the newest high school in out district which means that we have btter technology thatn the other scchools. We have a lot of digital reosurces that help with homeowrk. We can take classes that we think are suitable for our college courses.", "I liked the fact that we had technology at out disposal. However, a lot of the teachers there were only able to teach things one way, so if you didn't quite understand what you were learning there was nothing they could do about it. There were also a lot of teachers who just didn't teach anything at all.", 'AITE is a great school. It has impacted me to become a better student and peer to many. There I have made many friends. With the help of staff and my guidance counselor, I have finally decided what I want to achieve in life. I have finally received the closure I was looking for, for many years. This year as a sophomore I am taking classes based on my field of interest which is either Business or Finance & Banking.', 'Great school! I wish they would let underclassmen take more APs and advanced courses. Amazing Biomedical PLTW program!', 'Overall a great school. The teacher to student ratio is perfect, there’s a lot of diversity and everyone treats others the way they would like to be treated. You will really excel in AITE, especially with the help from others around you.', "I mean it's pretty good. The people are kind of weird but they're some lit people there. The school isn't the worst however it definitely isn't the best. Might want to switch a few teachers but other than that it isn't that bad.", 'AITE is a good school. Many teachers are willing to help students succeed and there are many resources available for students to use.', 'I like this school because it is college preparatory. It set me up to opportunities like this and gives laptops to students to increase the learning experience.', 'I liked how everyone was very open with their feelings and we were free to express who we are. The teachers help you work', "I love my high school. They're helping me prepare for college. I'm looking for so many scholarships and my guidance counselor is helping me. If they see you try hard they will help you.", 'The smaller school environment is great and there are some really good teachers here. I do not regret at all coming to AITE because it made me who I am today. One complaint is that the administration is fairly incompetent and does not focus enough on the students. Also there are some teachers that do not teach at all and make life very hard for students so you have to be careful what classes you take.', 'The Academy of Information Technology and Engineering is a school with a variety of courses that no other school offers. Rated one of the top high schools in Connecticut, AITE is yet to improve in very critical deparment areas. For example, the Math Department, there are more teachers that dont teach the material seriously.', 'The Academy of Information Technology and Engineering is a great school overall. We have classes that not many high schools have such as  Medical Interventions, Sports and Entertainment Management, Multimedia,  Arabic, and a lot more. We are advanced when it comes to variety in course selection. There will always be a class pertaining to any major, and if not, students are allowed to take a class online with Virtual High School. The teachers are excellent in providing students with college readiness. AITE is fantastic, however there are some minor setbacks, such as no sports teams and limited after school activities. But overall the experience at AITE is advanced because of the expansive classes, and admirable because of faculty, staff, and students.', 'My favourite part of AITE as a student was being able to take as many AP college classes as I wanted because I liked the ability to challenge myself.  I really appreciated the debate team as well, which anyone should join.', 'the school gives you the illusion of freedom and actually encourages you to learn. it forced you to make decions that can decide your future within the school', "AITE is a great school. It is unique compared to other local high schools because it provides students with a laptop and offers PLTW Biomedical Sciences and Engineering classes. Overall, the teachers are okay. They have a fantastic science department, but the math department needs some better teachers. I would like to see AITE have their own sports team because it's troublesome for some students to go to their district school to play sports.", 'I love the diversity and the amount of technology available at the school. The teachers and students made the school experience very rememberable.', 'A few things that I liked about AITE was the rigorous AP courses. My Physics course was especially hard, but I feel it prepared me for how hard college is going to be. Teachers are helpful if you ask them.']
